sub_title: Human Resources Officer | Project Manager | Executive Administrative Business Partner
summary:
Strategic Conception -> Collaboration -> Execution -> Deliverables -> Results 


A highly skilled leader that is able to make a lasting impact by creating positive changes within an organization, starting vertically with C levels, horizontally with IC’s, and by working with various implementation teams. An analytical thinker, with the ability to swap between the minutiae details and the bigger picture. A strategic and proactive biz ops executive assistant with an entire tool box of important skills, including, but not limited to, anticipation of needs, effective communication, decision making, critical thinking, strategic planning, problem solving, resourcefulness, accountability, project management, creator of process improvements, implementor of systems, along with the baseline requisite administrative skill set needed to support C-Suite executives that include the: CEO, COO, CFO, CPO, and CHRO. 

I've completed my MBA at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam which will allow me to maximize on my capabilities to assist companies in their strategic and organizational areas of interest that will result in increased sales and revenues, employee engagement and well being, DE&I, corporate social responsibility, and to ensure that they continue to strategically increase brand awareness to stay competitive and relevant in the market.

certifications.name: 5 Day Coding Challenge - HTML, CSS, & Javascript

profile_positions.description:
FRISS’s Trust Automation Platform provides real-time, data-driven scores and insights that give instant confidence and understanding of the inherent risks of all customers and interactions. Based on next-generation AI insurance technology, Trust Automation allows you to confidently manage trust throughout the insurance value chain – from the first quote all the way through claims and investigations when needed. Enable straight-through processing, automatically flag high risks and increase customer satisfaction.  

The real time FRISS Score is the core of our solutions and indicates the risk for each policy or claim. The AI-powered score combines Text Mining, Machine Learning, Predictive Models and Network Analysis with Expert Business Knowledge out of 15+ years of insurance experience, your specific business configuration, proprietary data and external data sources. It provides you a white box, holistic view on fraud and risks, which delivers you actionable insights so you stay in control.

profile_positions.description:
Funding Circle is a global small business loans platform, matching small businesses who want to borrow with investors who want to lend in the U.K., U.S., Germany, and the Netherlands. 

In 2018, we've helped 77k small businesses create and sustain 115k+ jobs by connecting them to our network of 93k investors, which allowed $10.9b to be invested in businesses globally.

Business owners and investors share a common thread. They’re forward thinkers. They’re determined. They stand up to make a difference and work hard to make it happen.

That same thread runs through everyone at Funding Circle. It’s a shared mission that inspires us – we help you as you change the world.

So whether you’re a business owner who aspires to more, or an investor who wants your money to go further, we believe in you. You’re the ones we built Funding Circle for.

Funding Circle is the world’s leading platform for small business lending and one of the best-capitalized lending platforms in the world and listed on the London Stock Exchange (Ticker: FCH) in October 2018. We have raised approximately $700 million since 2010 from some of the largest and most sophisticated investors around.

Our backers collectively manage over $5 trillion and are the leading firms behind Facebook, Twitter, Skype, and Betfair.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to U.S. Managing Director (CEO), C(Product)O, & C(People)O at Funding Circle US

Samsara has emerged as one of the fastest-growing Internet of Things (IoT) companies, and as a leader in connected operations. At Samsara, we believe that sensor data will increase the safety and efficiency of physical operations, and that new technologies will bring an explosion of sensors into environments where they’ve never been possible before.

Samsara’s mission is to bring the benefits of sensor data to the organizations that drive our economy—from transportation and logistics to construction, food production, energy, and manufacturing—and to improve the safety, efficiency, and quality of their operations.

profile_positions.description:
Experience w/ typical EA duties such as: calendar management, travel booking, expense reimbursements, invoice processing for payment, event planning, board meeting prep, and implementing / streamlining processes.

Non-traditional EA experience as a Project Manager taking on ad-hoc projects for 26 properties: San Francisco County certified notary that worked with multiple general counsels to compile and notarize documents for M&A deals / fulfilling subpoena requests. Worked with 3rd parties and internal stakeholders assisting execs and finance team with: auditing, reconciling, financial reporting, taxes, contracts, updating entity license renewals, managing insurance, obtaining permits, and ordering CAP EX items. Responsible for assisting HR with company-wide executive level and line level associates: new hire on-boarding, off-boarding (separations), employment verification, and employee background screening processes.

Create corporate standard operating procedures for F&B and catering sales to ensure proper protocols are followed. On the financial end, responsible for charging, balancing, closing, and posting banquet clients final check payments using Opera and Delphi systems. Performed payroll and scheduling functions, along with ordering for Banquet functions.

profile_positions.description: Graduate of the 1st STEPs management program at FS BW, our group project proposal for the Pool Renovation was chosen by the Regional VP / GM. Responsible for payroll, forecasting, scheduling, training, and managing 58 associates and managers for effective and efficient operations in 3 F&B outlets to ensure Four Seasons quality brand service is provided to guests. Conducted monthly department meetings, and trained associates on Forbes and LQA standards by creating & implementing Medallia contest in Oct 2014 to push scores and ended 2014 strong, IRD: 72.7%, Pool: 77.5%. Achieved our highest Medallia scores YTD due to Oct 2014 contest: Oct: 79.3%, Nov: 88.5%, Dec: 84.8%, Jan: 81.5%. Organize private parties in the suites for VIP guests, and deliver in-house amenities, group amenities, awards season amenities, and holiday amenities for 395 rooms.
profile_positions.title: Assistant In-Room Dining, Pool, & Private Bar Manager

profile_positions.description: Took part in making St. Regis Princeville #1 in our St. Regis Brand, and #1 St. Regis in GEI in 2012 by removing us as the #2 GEI defect in Private Dining to being off the list in 2 months, during 5 month interim Outlet Manager term, and also acted as Manager on Duty. Participated in Six Sigma Kaizen Event for VOC to establish VOC Six Sigma best practices for Starwood Company as well as being certified as Generation 10 Property Service Culture Trainer (PSCT), to facilitate St. Regis brand modules for new hires. Created stewarding order processes and assisted Director of Outlets in ordering glassware for the F&B Division worth $100k+ value. Interview, hire, train, supervise, and counsel managers and 100 F&B associates in 5 different outlets to ensure quality brand service is provided to guests. Responsible for scheduling, payroll, organizing, and executing in-house group and holiday amenity drops for 252 rooms in Private Dining, and creating SOPs for associates and compendium changes to meet new LRA standards.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Outlet Manager

profile_positions.title: Starwood Property Service Culture Trainer (PSCT)

Other management duties included: ordering equipment, supplies, chemicals, payroll,  scheduling, conducting quarterly inventories of over $300k worth of chinaware, glassware, silverware for 7 restaurant outlets, and working with culinary and banquets to support group functions that range anywhere from 5-1000+ people.

volunteer_experiences.role: Funding Circle Company GLIDE Volunteer Organizer & Team Lead Volunteer
volunteer_experiences.description:
"GLIDE is a social justice movement, social service provider and spiritual community dedicated to strengthening communities and transforming lives. Located in San Francisco’s culturally vibrant but poverty-stricken Tenderloin neighborhood, GLIDE addresses the needs of, and advocates for, the most vulnerable and marginalized individuals and families among us.

Building on the nearly 60-year legacy of Co-Founders Rev. Cecil Williams and Janice Mirikitani, GLIDE challenges inequities and stands with the poor, people of color, LGBTQ persons, and others facing oppression, isolation and stigma, while offering a holistic, integrated model of programs and services to address the complex needs of the community.

GLIDE continues to deepen its impact and extend its reach to thousands of people in need. Through comprehensive services, fearless advocacy and spiritual connection, GLIDE remains a powerful beacon of hope for a healthier, more just and inclusive city.

GLIDE's mission is to create a radically inclusive, just and loving community mobilized to alleviate suffering and break the cycles of poverty and marginalization. Our Core Values emerge from GLIDE as a spiritual movement. They are rooted in empowerment, recovery and personal transformation. Our values of being: radically inclusive, truth telling, loving & hopeful, for the people, and celebration --- assist to inspire and guide our behaviors. They are the ground we stand on.

By giving just a couple hours of your time, we have helped us serve hundreds of meals to our Glide community. Your presence at sends a powerful message to the hungry persons who eat with our Daily Free Meals Program – it says that you care and that they are worthy of your time and energy. The diverse group of people who regularly utilize our Meals Program include those who are homeless or insecurely housed, those whose lives have been impacted by substance use and/or mental illness, elders, and low-income families or individuals."

The Master's VU International Student Ambassador duties are to assist and answer questions from prospective incoming VU International Master's student candidates to help guide them through their decision making process and hopefully attract top candidates to attend VU for their Master's program.

The Marketing Association Amsterdam (MAA) is a career association for students in the end phase of their studies (third year BA, pre-master, or master students) with an interest in marketing, consultancy, management or communication.
